comments:
While developing a Hello World RCP application using eclipse-SDK-3.1M5a-win32 
(and eclipse-RCP-3.1M5a-win32) I observed a BadLocationException in the .log 
file.

0.  Create a new Hello World RCP application using the wizard and templates.
1.  Open a plugin.xml
2.  Turn to the Dependencies page of the editor.
3.  From the "Required Plug-ins" section, select the org.eclipse.ui plug-in.
4.  From the "Dependency Analysis" section, click the "Compute Dependency
    Extent" link.
5.  Using the Error Log view, check the contents of .log file.


org.eclipse.jface.text.BadLocationException
 at org.eclipse.jface.text.AbstractLineTracker.getLineOffset
(AbstractLineTracker.java:275)
 at org.eclipse.jface.text.AbstractDocument.getLineOffset
(AbstractDocument.java:820)
 at 
org.eclipse.search2.internal.ui.text.PositionTracker.convertToCharacterPosition
(PositionTracker.java:154)
 at org.eclipse.search2.internal.ui.text.EditorAccessHighlighter.createPosition
(EditorAccessHighlighter.java:91)
 at org.eclipse.search2.internal.ui.text.EditorAccessHighlighter.addHighlights
(EditorAccessHighlighter.java:59)
 at org.eclipse.search2.internal.ui.text.EditorAnnotationManager.addAnnotations
(EditorAnnotationManager.java:196)
 at 
org.eclipse.search2.internal.ui.text.EditorAnnotationManager.searchResultChanged
(EditorAnnotationManager.java:97)
 at org.eclipse.search.ui.text.AbstractTextSearchResult.fireChange
(AbstractTextSearchResult.java:259)
 at org.eclipse.search.ui.text.AbstractTextSearchResult.addMatch
(AbstractTextSearchResult.java:82)
 at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.search.dependencies.DependencyExtentOperation.findMa
tches(DependencyExtentOperation.java:90)
 at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.search.dependencies.DependencyExtentOperation.checkF
orExtensionPointsUsed(DependencyExtentOperation.java:76)
 at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.search.dependencies.DependencyExtentOperation.execut
e(DependencyExtentOperation.java:68)
 at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.search.dependencies.DependencyExtentQuery.run
(DependencyExtentQuery.java:28)
 at org.eclipse.search2.internal.ui.InternalSearchUI$InternalSearchJob.run
(InternalSearchUI.java:93)
 at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

Wassim,
There is a one line change (attached) that seems to fix the problem.  Can you 
check that this is a right fix?  In addition of changing "point" to "extensions
[i]" also required subtracting -1 from the line number which makes me 
suspicious if extensions[i] is the right element we want to put the marker on.
Thanks.
